details.title: Detectability of Burst-Like Signals
details.abstract: The detectability of signals with burst-like qualities is investigated. Detectability is interpreted in terms of the performance of the optimum (likelihood ratio) detector for this type of signal. At low false alarm probabilities, long signal bursts interspersed by long periods of signal absence are found to be more detectable than short, rapid bursts. Essentially opposite results are true for shorter bursts.
details.journal_title: IEEE Transactions on Aerospace and Electronic Systems
